titles.title: RS93 Begin, my tongue, some heavenly theme

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Begin, my tongue, some heavenly theme;
and speak some boundless thing,
The mighty works, or mightier name,
Of our eternal King.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Tell of His wondrous faithfulness,
And sound His power abroad;
Sing the sweet promise of His grace,
And the fulfilling God.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Engraved as in eternal brass,
The mighty promise shines;
Nor can the powers of darkness rase
Those everlasting lines.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
His every word of grace is strong
As that which built the skies:
The voice that rolls the stars along
Speaks all the promises.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
O might I hear thy heavenly tongue
but whisper, 'Thou art mine';
those gentle words should raise my song
to notes almost divine.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
How would my leaping heart rejoice
To know my heaven secure:
I trust the all-creating voice,
And faith desires no more.
